headline: Spinach Brownies
description: Spinach and mozzarella cheese are baked together to make irresistible savory appetizer treats.

video.description: Healthy snack, side dish, breakfast - these are a delicious way to get your greens!
video.name: Spinach Brownies

name: Spinach Brownies
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 ounce) package spinach, rinsed and chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Place spinach in a medium saucepan with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil. Lower heat to simmer and cook until spinach is limp, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat, drain, and set aside.
In a large bowl, mix flour, salt and baking powder. Stir in eggs, milk and butter. Mix in spinach, onion and mozzarella cheese.
Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool before serving.

review.reviewBody: I loved this recipe it smells glorious and tastes wonderful.

I have almost the same recipe from 30 years ago. The only difference is 1/4 c butter, and 16 oz Monterey Jack cheese, but no onion. We call it "Spinach Appetizer." Delish! I like the idea of adding garlic powder and onions.

Made this for a family lunch, followed the recipe using fresh spinach with no other changes but this fell flat - literally! Was thin, tasted just okay and looked odd in the serving dish. I would not make this again or recommend it. - Dec 2022
Really tasty and a great side to tomato soup!

I have made this same recipe for over 10+ years and it's always a hit. I have also become vegan since I started using this recipe. I simply make homemade vegan cashew cheese and use cashew milk and it still tastes amazing.
Very tasty... used 1/2 the salt, sauteed the onions first with some garlic, and reduced the butter by half. Also swapped half the mozzarella for parmesan. Yum!
I love these. Made with several different cheeses. My favorite it a cheddar mix. I use whatever I have in the refrigerator. All are good.
Using this recipe for more than two years now; it is became family staple; the only tweak I made is replaces 1/2 cup of butter melted with 1/2 cup of canola oil; Thank you so much for the recipe.
Loved it!

I love this recipe! I think I've made it a little differently almost every time because the other reviews had so many great suggestions. I like to halve the amount of butter and saute the onions until well cooked. Add the spinach to the pan and continue to saute until wilted, then add minced garlic and cook just until fragrant. I use seasoning salt instead of plain salt and add a pinch of paprika. I've tried it with italian seasoning and also with a pinch of red pepper flakes alternatively. They're both good depending on your mood. I've only ever used mozzerella but may try others in the future ... mixed italian cheeses or white cheddar sound good. I see this being a part of my regular rotation all the time!
Easy, tasty recipe. It’s a keeper, will definitely make it again.
Great for family gatherings. Freezes well for snacks. I also saute the frozen spinach, garlic, and onions together.

Wow, my family demolished the whole pan! I browned the onions in canola oil, used 1 Tbl butter in the mixture, and used half the cheese. I also used a package of frozen spinach. Baked in the air fryer. The top was beautifully browned and it tasted great! What a wonderful way to get spinach into our teenagers.
Amazing- I used a mix of cheese and used sautéed greens (whatcabbage, Swiss chard, escarole, spinach)
Can’t believe how yummy this was! Great appetizer or side!
One of my favorite recipes! I've been making these for years and they are always enjoyed. I used a 16oz bag of spinach, 1 tsp garlic powder and add a half cup of parmigiano. Sooo good!!
I made it exactly as written, which resulted in a mushy, unappertizing texture.

11.28.20 ... https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/26972/spinach-brownies/ .. This Thanksgiving spinach appetizer was barely touched. 'Only change was halved the butter & added some mushrooms. Bland, bland.
Call for too much onion which was overpowering.
Added broccoli. It was amazing.

Yum! I followed the advise of others, and halved the butter. Sauteed onion with garlic and italian seasoning, added salt and pepper. Wilted the spinach into the mix. Salt and pepper. Added a can of chopped mushrooms and a couple cups of chopped chicken. Added more italian seasoning to the wet ingredients. Used 3 1/2 cups cheese. Turned out beautiful! I topped each square with a spoonful of pizza sauce! Definately will be making this regularly. Even my 2 yr old ate this!
Great dish! I doubled the ingredients and added portobello mushrooms,red peppers, onions and carrots, still used 9”x13” pan. Great for breakfast or dinner - With a little marinara sauce on top!
I will add to bacon to it next time to see how it tastes.

The first time I followed the recipe. Good, but needed something...
Second time I did as some suggested and added bacon and reduced the butter. Since then I’ve tweaked it to our particular taste. Added bacon, less butter, cheese is a mix of mexican cheese blend and mozzarella, no salt, added chopped garlic.
One of my go to recipes now. Everyone loves them and ask for the recipe.

I made this last night. I used a dish that was not as big as stated in the recipe, when I put the mixture in the dish, it was a good 1” thick, but after baking, it was quite flat. I would not call this an appetizer but rather a side dish. I used 10 ounce of frozen chopped spinach that I just squeeze the water out of rather than using fresh spinach which saves a step as you don’t have to cook it. Next time, I will use an even smaller dish, probably a 9” square which should keep it from being so flat! I would also leave out the salt because it did taste somewhat salty and the mozzarella cheese has salt in it so the other salt is unnecessary, in my opinion. I’m still debating as to whether I will make it again.
This recipe is terrific! Didn't have mozzarella on hand so used cheddar, still excellent!
I used Monterey Jack and added four slices of crumbled crispy bacon. It turned out great! I didn't think it looked much like brownies, though.

My kids love this recipe! I only use half of an onion and cook it a little with the butter while it’s melting. I also reduce salt to 1/2 tsp and add 1/2 tsp garlic salt and a little Parmesan cheese as well. Always a hit!!!
Amazing! I will be making this quite a few times

I really like these!! Made them with gluten free flour instead (make sure it has the xantham gum in it) and halved the recipe. When using gluten free flour I found that adding a little more spinach than called for helps the moisture ratio.

This is a great snack. I used frozen spinach , but should have used 2 boxes. I also only used about 2 tablespoons of butter. 
I used whole wheat flour , which overpowered the taste a little. And I used cheddar cheese. , and cooked my onions first. This recipe is very easy, and makes a lot. Garlic powder adds a good subtle flavor. Try it !

These are great but definitely let them cool for a bit. Made mine and everyone ate them while they were hot, finally had one when it cooled and they're ten times better cooled down a bit. Made mine by cooking bacon in the oven, once that was done, removed the bacon from the pan, threw 2 boxes of chopped spinach into the bacon grease and backed in the oven for about 7 or so mins. Drained the fat from it, mixed it with sautéed garlic and onion, mozzarella & bacon, threw some parmesan cheese on top and cooked it. Probably the best healthy (sugar wise) snack around.
It was amazing! I followed the recipe given and it turned out great. Next time, I think I would add garlic powder to add more taste to it but its delicious anyhow.
Easy and delicious. A friend who never eats vegetables LOVED it.

I used organic eggs, cauliflower flour, turmeric ghee, and vegan mozzarella. 

It did not come out like the picture (prob my substitutions) 
They were moist cake like. Tasted good
All I can say is Oh Yum! I made these twice - the first time exactly per the recipe - the second I added some fresh parmesan to give it a little pop.

I used half the butter (1/4 cup), sauteed garlic and onions and added it to the cooked spinach, also added a 6 oz. can of mushrooms drained. Used 5 oz. of mozzarella with 3 oz. feta cheese and 2 oz. swiss cheese, sprinkled the top with shredded parmigian cheese. This was a hit!
A big hit at the Secret Santa party. One of us is a vegetarian, but even the non-vegs loved these. Personally, they're my new favorite snack, and I'm not veg at all.

Delicious!
My whole family loved it! 
I will definitely make this again because not only is it tasty, but it is also super easy make.
Next time I prepare it, I will add a little less butter. But overall, excellent!
My 23-year old vegetarian loved these, and so did we! Great for a dinner side dish and quick breakfast the next day.

Thanks for the inspiration! I just added my first recipe (Keto Quiche) to Allrecipes because of this dish. I made a modified version of this over Christmas for my Keto following family and they loved it!!! I tripled the eggs, reduced the butter, substituted almond and coconut flour, and added some bell peppers. I have also made this with broccoli instead of onion.

This is a wonderful base recipe! I made it using feta cheese, and found I didn't need to add the salt. I've added onions, black olives, chopped red or green peppers, bacon.....use your own imagination!
These were good except too salty - next time I would omit the salt. I also only used 5 Tblsp of butter.
Great flavor, was a hit with the whole family. The only thing I did different was I had a 16 oz bag of spinach instead of the 10 oz it called for.
Made these as an appetizer in mini muffin tin. Sauteed onions and garlic then added spinach to wilt as suggested by others. They turned out delicious. Will definitely be making again

Absolutely delicious. I added garlic, cayenne & crumbled turkey sausage. Red pepper flakes on top added zing to the leftovers straight outta the microwave. So good. I used 8oz sharp cheddar vs mozz as that’s all I had on hand. Will duplicate additions for next time as well.
Very tasty. I feel like it needs something crunchy, but I'm not sure what. I'll be adding something for this effect next time.

Got a few odd looks when answeing, "spinach brownie" lol. 

Between the directions and taking into account some reviews, here's what I did.... 
I sauteed the onions, added bacon and red, orange, yellow peppers and used fresh spinach. 
There were concerns about to much butter, so I just used the butter that I sauteed the onions in and I didn't add any more (like the recipe calls for). I did grease the pan with butter though, generously. 

Overall, it was very good. I was well pleased! 
Bonus* Add cranberry sauce to it and it's like a dessert ;)
Delicious, very light with a lot of flavor. I might add a little bacon or sausage next time for more texture.
Absolutely my kids favorite.
This was ok. It seemed the spinach flavor got lost in the brownie. Perhaps that's the point for some. My picky eater certainly enjoyed these. They actually taste better the next day.

I stumbled upon this recipe at least 10 yrs ago, it has become a favorite among everyone who has ever tried them and so now I feel quite obliged to write a review.
I love how easy this recipe is to change to fit anyone's liking. I have made this recipe exactly as written, as well as changed up almost the whole dish itself. I love adding bacon and using the grease in place of the butter. I have added fresh herbs to this like parsley, oregano and basil. I have also used half and half spinach/kale as well as entirely replaced the spinach with kale. (I am not a fan of kale but it is soooo delicious in this recipe) Every single time I have used this recipe it ALWAYS comes out absolutely DE-LISH. I have even made this for children ranging all different ages as young as 9mos and older and ALL of them love it too, they ask me to make it all the time. Not to mention it is SOOOO EASY to make, almost effortless. Thank you so much for sharing this recipe it has become our families favorite!!

I sauteed baby spinach and onion in some of the 1/2 C butter from the recipe but still followed the recipe.. I didn't want to steam the spinach. I LOVED IT! It was so good! I used a 9x9 dish not a 9x13 and it worked perfectly. I didn't have any problems that others had. My husband & son didn't care for it but they are both miserable picky eaters who hate all veggies so they're opinion doesn't count!
I love this recipe! It's such a unique way to use spinach and it tastes great! I have been devouring the leftovers since my mom made it. My mom added garlic to boost the flavor and I think it helped.
Yummy! I sautéed garlic with the onion and added cooked bacon to the batter. Since I am gluten-free I used Domata gf flour for the regular flour and was just fine. Will make this again!
My whole family loves these. I have made them as usual and I have also added bacon and baked them in mini muffin tins for more of a appetizer.
added sautéed onion, garlic, mushrooms and used mixed cheeses (using up all cheese I had on hand).

I had to become a member to rate this. I love it. I served it with homemade ranch and it was super. I've eaten a quarter of the pan and I'm afraid I'm not done. I might try to use half the butter next time.

I used garlic powder because I had no cloves, and I forgot to add the powder to the mixture so I had to sprinkle it on the top after it had already been baking a few minutes, and it was still great. I used the convection oven and a metal pan, and it made the bottom of the bars nice and brown.

After reading many many reviews I made these. Used one box frozen chopped spinach, cooked and drained. Cooked the onion in 2 TBS butter (no extra butter), added spinach, salt &pepper and garlic powder, whisked the eggs with the milk, I used bag of shredded Mexican mix cheese (it was what I had in house) I think I will try Feta next time. Mixed all together. Came out great, nice spinachy texture and taste.
We did not care for this, did not make any changes.

Took to a card party and they were a hit. I doubled up the spinach like many suggested and went with the Italian cheese blend. Next time I will use an extra egg and add some peppers or something with a bit of kick. Will definitely come back to this one.

Made this twice, the 1st time I made the recipe as written. It was good as is, a little too oily and I didn't care for the slightly cooked onion.

2nd time I cut the butter to 1/4 c (2 Tbsp to cook onions, 2 Tbsp for flour mixture). Absolutely delicious with these two simple changes and doesn't stray too much from the original recipe.
I added turkey sausage & a little sage. I also omitted the butter. It was excellent.

Made It in 7x9 dish for Super Bowl "kickoff". It was just right for brownie size portions, "scored" nicely and could be eaten as finger food. Delicious, and several people asked for recipe. A "winner".

Made it in 9x13 this time for a side with soups. Smells divine.

I could have eaten the whole pan in one sitting (and believe me, I wanted to). Even the aroma is wonderful while it’s baking. This recipe is nearly perfect. I plan to make it the next time I entertain. The only tweak is that I halved the butter for the second batch - and it’s just as tasty.

I didn't want all of the flour and milk so I cut that down to 1/4 cup of each. The result may be too thin for some people but it tastes divine and has a lot less carbs and calories. 

Great!

Excellent make ahead breakfast food for the week. Cook a little turkey sausage on the side to make it the perfect little breakfast. I did what others suggested with bacon and roasted red pepper. Delish! Did not add melted butter to mixture. Next time will try it instead with almond milk, goat cheddar and manchego so the lactose intolerant in my family may eat it.
Ate them like they were chocolate brownies with icing. Good stuff.
These are wonderful -- easy to make. Every time I make them, everyone loves them and I am always being asked for the recipe
Nice recipe which kids and adults alike will love! Went well serve at dinner with ham and will definitely make again!

Really GOOD!!! I followed the recipe, then made changes the next time. I gave it a Greek flair by Reducing the Mozzarella to 4 OZ. and replacing it with FETA cheese and 1/2 tea. Dill Weed. It was reminiscent of the flavors of Spanikopita, but much less work. Make sure you really squeeze out the liquid from the spinach after cooking it. I also followed another reviewers recommendation of sauteing the onions first. I thought is was equally delicious cold the next day.
I loved this dish and so did my church family! With so many dishes to choose from, people came back for seconds and more. It was a big hit.
A bit bland but easy to pick up.
It was a quick and easy delicious appetizer to bring to a holiday party - and nutritious too!
Double the recipe works well in the same pan
I use Monterrey Jack cheese instead. This is a fixture on our Holiday table
Delicious! I didn't have shredded mozzarella but I did have fresh mozzarella. I cubed it up and added a little parmesan and it worked just fine!

Add Bacon! This is always a hit when I make it for parties. I cut it into triangles for presentation. I agree with others, add bacon...about 1/2 pound cooked and crumbled. Also, saute the onions with a little garlic and add to spinach. And, I add a little nutmeg...1/2 teaspoon. REALLY good recipe!

These were delicious! Like others, I cut the butter in half, and the next time (there will be one!) I will cut back even a bit more. It just isn't necessary, and it adds so much fat. They were easy to make, but it did take me longer to prep than the directions state, probably because I used fresh spinach and had to chop it first. I had a few leftovers; they kept well in the fridge and were great heated up just a bit in the microwave. Highly recommend this recipe!
Great!
I think I would like it just a tad more bready
Very yummy! Ive made this a number of times now. Everyone loves it. Just make sure that you squeeze out the spinach so that it's not to wet.
Less butter and sauteed onion as suggested. Used 2/3 Mozzarella and 1/3 parmesan cheese. Should have spiced it up a bit, but it was well received.
Delicious. Sauted onions with garlic and a teaspon of butter, then added the spinach. Added only a teaspon of butter to the batter, but it didnt need it. Will definitely make it again.
No changes needed to this recipe. It is delicious as is. I have made it several times. When I do I get many recipe requests! It taste's just as good when I make it gluten free.
This is a recipe that I ALWAYS use for family functions. My inlaws beg for them! Perfect! I usually use mixed cheeses and saute the onion, spinach and garlic in the butter before adding!
Just added some crushed red pepper for some heat...delish!
Made as listed. Used individual cupcake molds instead of a pan. Turned out great!! Very easy and quick. Will make again.

Easy to whip up. Made a change or 2 though: sauteed mushrooms in 1TBS butter in a large skillet until most all moisture was gone then added the fresh spinach and covered with a lid for 5 mins. After mixing mushrooms and spinach into the wet mixture I used the same skillet to melt the butter. Also swapped the 1 tsp salt for 1 tsp black pepper and a pinch of salt.

My mom used to make these and called them spinach squares. I had forgotten about them.. I sauted the onion with garlic and a four tbls butter and added the spinach to pan. I melted butter to add to mixture but forgot about it. Daughter found the butter in the microwave the next day. We ate the whole pan anyhow. Love these.
I made it exactly as the recipe called for and the spinach brownies turned out great. I will definitely make them again. I keep them in the fridge for a nice, halfway healthy snack.
Yes I will make it again,
I can not eat onions so I used minced onions and onion powder. I cooked it ten minutes longer and it was delicious
delicious and easy to prepare

I've had a recipe very close to this one for many years, and have made it often. They're always a huge hit when I take them to potlucks & cookouts. One thing...these SHOULD be called "Spinach Bars" NOT "Spinach Brownies".

Thank you for a very easy recipe for a great snack or breakfast. I followed the recipe as directed and can see the countless option to add to this- Left over broccoli, various cheeses. I do wish i had added garlic and will in the future along with other spices as it was bland- but a great base- and so easy to make!
They were a hit even with my non-veggie eaters.
I make this frequently and they are absolutely delicious. When we need to bring a dish to pass for a gathering, this is what I am requested to please bring.
Excellent, everyone loved it. Also made it and took it to a potluck as an appetizer, it was devoured.
